abstract: A regulatory filing shows Bank of America’s chief executive, Brian Moynihan, has bought 30,000 shares of common stock in the company, a possible signal to Wall Street that the executive believes BofA’s stock is undervalued.
snippet: A regulatory filing shows Bank of America’s chief executive, Brian Moynihan, has bought 30,000 shares of common stock in the company, a possible signal to Wall Street that the executive believes BofA’s stock is undervalued.
lead_paragraph: A regulatory filing shows that Bank of America‘s chief executive, Brian Moynihan, has bought 30,000 shares of common stock in the company, a possible signal to Wall Street that the executive believes the stock is undervalued.

headline.main: BofA Chief Buys 30,000 Shares of Company Stock
